title: Storing Cookie Dough Before Baking

items.name: Fridge for 1-2 days
items.details: Keep dough tightly covered in the fridge in an airtight container to prevent drying out or absorbing other flavors. Good for up to 2 days before baking.

items.name: Pre-portion for convenience
items.details: Scoop dough into balls and store in an airtight container in the fridge. When ready to bake, pop them straight onto a baking sheet.

items.name: Freezer for longer storage
items.details: If storing longer than 2 days, use the freezer instead of the fridge.

items.name: Bring to room temp before baking
items.details: Take the dough out of the fridge while the oven preheats. Let it sit at room temperature for 20-30 minutes to take the chill off. This helps the cookies bake more evenly.

notes: For short-term storage (1-2 days), the fridge is perfect. The freezer is only necessary for longer storage periods. Always let refrigerated dough warm slightly before baking for best results.
